10/10
Fun puzzle platformer. I had a blast playing this.

To be frank I didn't really enjoy the gameplay, something that started to drag on me during some of the harder puzzles.

Despite that I still love the game, not for the "game" but for the characters and world building. GLaDOS's sarcastic personality returns to this game from the first but that isn't the only side we see now. New characters are added and GLaDOS is further understood and even empathised with.

Buy it if you haven't played it yet.
Love this game. Not only is it challenging and takes some out of the box thinking it also includes dry humour which makes me laugh. I recommend this game to anyone that enjoys puzzle type games

[h1] Let‚Äôs review : Portal 2      [/h1]

Welcome back to Aperture test subject. Famous words. This is what is called a true sequel to an already great game. Portal 2 offers the follow up on the events from Portal, and expands on it, bringing you to the ‚Äúbackstage‚Äù of Aperture, and introduces new characters. Also you‚Äôll get know more about the Aperture Lore, and it‚Äôs creator ‚Äì Cave Johnson, voiced by the incredible actor ‚Äì J.K. Simmons. Glad0s is also back with no improvement to her personality.

[h1] Pros: [/h1]

+ New maps, new challenges and plus, a Co-Op mode with an actual campaign. Where you and your buddy are Robots that must experience all the Aperture Science division has to offer! And it will ‚Äúforce‚Äù you think co-operatively if you want to succeed 
+ Awesome continuity on the story from the previous installment, which helps to put some things in perspective.
+ New game mechanics, like the propulsion gel which helps you reach new heights and therefore create a series of new challenges that demand your brain to think it over! Or even the Repulsion gel that does, you guessed it, repels you!
+ Cards and Achievements! Both single player and Coop ones!

 [h1] Cons: [/h1]

-	None that I can honestly find! 

[h1] Final Review [/h1]

Portal 2 deserves all the praise it got, and you get treated to not one campaign, but two campaigns, doubling the amount of fun you can have within this game. And the Coop robots are incredibly fun, and the puzzles and much harder than before. Portal 2 is a must have for every gamer, so I have to give this sequel a proud 9.5 out of 10. And the Cake is still a lie!

Enjoy Guys and Girls, and if this review helped you in any way please leave me a Thumbs up, i would appreciate it immensely. And please consider joining me on Curate This ‚Äì A Honest Review at:

http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31479106/
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCyoVCbpqhmQAIVKVgQBZf9w?view_as=public

Liked first Portal for its innovative approach but story left me a little bit disappointed. Knowing that I didn't expect much from this game. Boy was I wrong. So much depth and story behind a simple puzzle game. I should have known better, since it is Valve game after all. Not to spoil the game for others, I advise picking this one up. Don't let the original game influence your decision (for better or worse) as this game has so many things going for it. Perfect controls, story, compexity, progression. Everything is where it should be, especially the ending.
i think portal is an super fun puzzle game and that there should be a third portal

The first time I played Portal 2 was in late fall or early winter of 2012 on my PS3, I had no idea what to expect, but I'm infinitely pleased with what I've gotten, ever since that fateful Fall/Winter night I've been in love ever since. I've played this game 4 times (and the original Portal 3 times) and every playthrough was just as enjoyable as the last one, maybe even better. I have no friends so I can't play the multiplayer segment with anyone but I'm just going to assume it's pretty good, there's certainly a reason this game is one of the best reviewed games of all time. The story is surprisingly good and the gameplay is even better, I hate puzzles but I still had way too much fun with this game. The dialogue his hilarious and insanely quoteable, and the ending song is somehow even better than Still Alive (that's actually up to debate) but I love Portal 2 more than I love my children. Mainly because my childrend don't exist. But when my children exist I'll probably still love Portal 2 more.

Ich kann das Spiel nur empfehlen! Wer etwas zum knobeln braucht, dass man auch mit Freunden (Cross-Plattform zwischen Linux und Windows einwandfrei m√∂glich - selbst getestet) zusammen spielen kann, ist hier genau richtig. Man versteht die Handlung, auch wenn man die erste Version nicht kennt. Ich pers√∂nlich hoffe auf einen dritten Teil, da das Spiel zwar sehr kurzweilig aber kurz ist und es logischerweise keinen Sinn macht ein Level ein zweites mal zu l√∂sen wenn man die L√∂sung kennt. Aber trotzdem ein super Spiel!
